itemGroup.extshape.wooden_blocks: §9Extended Block Shape:§r Wooden and Bamboo Blocks
modmenu.descriptionTranslation.extshape:
This mod adds more shapes for many vanilla blocks, including shapes that do not exist in vanilla Minecraft, like vertical slabs, vertical stairs or quarter pieces. Most of the blocks have vanilla behaviours, like what their base block behaves. For example, bedrock stairs and slabs are explosion-immune and wither-immune like bedrock, and wool fences and fence gates are flammable and can be sheared.
With this mod you can make more fascinating buildings, and your survival can be also more interesting.
modmenu.summaryTranslation.extshape: More shapes for many vanilla blocks, which behave like in vanilla.
options.extshape.title: Configuration of Extended Block Shapes Mod
options.extshape.addToVanillaGroups.tool: Add blocks added by this mod to Minecraft's vanilla Creative Mode item groups. For example, all stairs, slabs, etc., are added to "%s" groups; fences and walls are added to "%s" group, and fence gates, pressure plates and buttons are added to "%s" group. Items are sort in the order they are defined, so the item list could be messy, but if you installed Reasonable Sorting Mod, then this option is preferred.
options.extshape.showSpecificGroups.tool: Add four specific item groups to display blocks that have different shapes (including vanilla and mod) in a fancy order. They are sorted by their base blocks, and blocks based on a same block are displayed together.
options.extshape.preventWoodenWallRecipe: Prevent the crafting recipes of wooden walls, in order to avoid the conflict with wooden trapdoors. When ON, you cannot craft wooden walls. If you installed mods that solve recipe conflict, you can turn this option OFF.
Avoid the crafting recipes of some buttons, in order to avoid the conflict with other items. For instance, the recipe of diamond button from a diamond block conflicts with breaking a diamond block down to 9 diamond items. When ON, you cannot craft those buttons, so that the crafting of other items are ensured. If you installed mods that solve recipe conflict, you can turn this option OFF.
options.extshape.specialSnowSlabCrafting: When ON, snow slab is crafted from a snow layer block, instead of three snow blocks. This is intended to avoid the conflict with the recipe of snow layer. If you have installed mods that solve recipe conflict, you can turn this option OFF.
options.extshape.confirm.noGroups: Your both '%s' and '%s' are set '%s', which means in Creative Mode you may not directly obtain items in this mod in your Creative inventory. Are you sure to continue?
options.extshape.registerBlockFamilies.d:
Register the relations of the block to Minecraft's vanilla BlockFamilies. The BlockFamilies registry may be identified by some mods, but may cause potential problems when other mods use the BlockFamilies. You usually do not need to enable it.
Takes effect after restarting game.
options.extshape.rrp.title: Runtime Resource Pack settings
options.extshape.rrp.description: Manage the Runtime Resource Pack of Extended Block Shapes mod.
options.extshape.rrp.regenClientResource: Regenerate the client resources of the runtime resource pack of this mod, not influencing vanilla and other mods. This is primitively used for development and does not take effect. Regenerated resources are applied only after pressing F3+T.
options.extshape.rrp.regenServerData.des: Regenerate the server data of the runtime resource pack of this mod, not influencing vanilla and other mods. This is primitively used for development and does not take effect. Regenerated resources are applied only after using "/data" command.
options.extshape.rrp.exportClientResourc: Export client resource of runtime resource pack in the specified path so that you can see its content, as if it is a regular resource pack.
options.extshape.rrp.exportServerData.de: Export server data of runtime resource pack in the specified path so that you can see its content, as if it is a regular data pack.
options.extshape.reasonable-sorting.desc:
If you installed Reasonable Sorting mod, you can define how block items are sorted according to their shape, including shapes provided this mod. It may not affect blocks provided by other mods.

You can also access the mod config screen of Reasonable Sorting by selecting the mod in the mod menu.

If there is no response on clicking this button, it's likely that you have not installed Reasonable Sorting mod or the version is too low.
options.extshape.dataChanged: Server data changed. Regenerated server data?
options.extshape.dataChanged.details: The mod uses runtime resource pack, which is generated on the initialization of Minecraft. You have modified options related to data generation, which may take affect by regenerating server data of this mod. You should also type §7/reload§r command if the server (including the integrated server of single-player mode) is currently running.
options.dataChanged.finish: The server data of runtime resource pack is re-generated. If you're in single player mode or you're the server owner, please execute %s to apply recipe change. Note that in multiplayer mode only the configuration of server host is valid.
message.extshape.recipe_conflict.start: Starting recipe conflict check, which may take a while.
message.extshape.recipe_conflict.excepti: Exceptions were found when detecting recipe conflict
Finished checking. In total no recipe conflicts have been found.
Finished checking. In total %s recipe conflict has been found.
Finished checking. In total %s recip conflicts have been found.
